EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of two Stone Furnaces:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) equipped with burner‑inserters and an output chest.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) configured similarly.
Use-case: Automates the smelting of raw materials.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• Burner‑Mining Drill at Position(x=-15.0, y=-50.0) connected to a Wooden Chest at Position(x=-13.5, y=-51.5) via transport belts.
Use-case: Enables continuous extraction and transfer of iron ore.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• A Laboratory unit that receives automation‑science‑pack inputs.
• Supported by a network of small electric poles.
Use-case: Advances research and technology.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) with connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5) and a designated steam output at Position(x=6.5, y=20.5).
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5) providing water.
• Pre‑existing Steam Engines placed at Position(x=0.5, y=9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), and (22.5, 18.5).
• An extra Steam Engine intended for integration at approximately Position(x=12.5, y=21.5) remains unplaced.
Use-case: Generates electrical power via steam‑driven technology.

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
### Extra Steam Engine Placement Failures
• The extra steam engine consistently fails to be placed due to severe congestion around the boiler at Position(8.0, 20.5).
• The designated buildable target—approximately at Position(8.5, 22.5)—is completely obstructed by overlapping and misaligned entities, including burner‑inserters and transport belts.
• Manual intervention is mandatory:
 – Perform an exhaustive manual inspection of the boiler area and all its connection interfaces.
 – Remove or reposition interfering entities (e.g., adjust misaligned burner‑inserters and re‑route overlapping transport belts) to clear sufficient space.
 – Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a dedicated less‑congested zone or modifying the boiler layout to ensure proper clearance for pipe connections and machine placement.
